citation.article-title: Olivibacter sitiensis gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from alkaline olive-oil mill wastes in the region of Sitia, Crete
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Olivibacter [O.li.vi.bac′ter. L. n. oliva olive; N.L. masc. n. bacter a rod; N.L. masc. n. Olivibacter a rod-shaped bacterium from olives/olive processing by-product].
Cells are Gram-negative, non-motile and rod-shaped, developing in irregular, pigmented creamy white colonies.
Menaquinone-7 is present in the respiratory chain.
The major fatty acids are C16 : 1ω7c and/or iso-C15 : 0 2-OH, iso-C15 : 0, iso-C17 : 0 3-OH, and C16 : 0.
The DNA G+C content is 45.6 mol%.
The type species is Olivibacter sitiensis.
